data.title: Bill Nunn Memorial Award Winners
data.text:
The Bill Nunn Memorial Award is presented annually by the Professional Football Writers of America in recognition of long and distinguished reporting in the field of pro football. The award, which originated in 1969, was renamed in 2021 in tribute to Nunn, a longtime writer and editor at the Pittsburgh Courier.

In addition to his esteemed career in journalism, Nunn worked for roughly half a century in the Pittsburgh Steelersâ€™ scouting department. In 2021, he became the first African American elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in the Contributor category.

Award Winners:
